runs.comm: Welcome to the big time! Full, fast, late outswing. Get a bat on that ...
another ripper. Fast and zipping past the edge, and Noor barely left his stance before he was beaten
banged in short, too short in fact, and Afghanistan's challenge is up and running
too good from Steyn. Tight line outside off, found a thin edge, and Boucher pouched the chance
full and bending sharply, but Shahzad meets that with a firm clip through midwicket. The first runs off the bat
outside off, late swing, left alone
massive appeal for caught-behind, and is that two in the over? No, it's not. Steyn is aghast but umpire Taufel is unmoved. I think there was bat on that ...
width outside off, no stroke offered there
a wild swish, and Langeveldt's subtle swingers are too canny for that shot
short, and swatted over square leg, a touch fortuitous, but it lands safe
beauty. Hits the seam and climbs past the edge from a good length
no foot movement, merely an ambitious mow. No contact either
cracked out to point, superb fielding from de Villiers, and a direct hit would have been out
great bowling again, he gets that outswinger going at will. Left alone
a wafty drive, no contact there as the ball ghosts away late
cherry-picking from Steyn. Tighter line, a touch less swing, but more bounce, and a simple snick through to the keeper
too much pace and bounce for the umpire's liking. That was out of reach
drawn forward, and again the ball zips away late from a batsman with a rooted stance
pushed back onto the stumps, and beaten outside off
back into the crease and wafted down to third man
regulation dismissal. Tight line, unnerving bounce, a simple edge and Kallis at first slip swallows the catch. That was reminiscent of England at Johannesburg
clipped down to third man, and the batsman runs straight into Morkel in his followthrough! He eventually gets to the far end to get off the mark
pushed back into the crease and defended
short and nasty, Sadiq was backing away but the ball kept coming, and de Villiers at point pocketed a looping gloved catch
that's runs! A slash outside off stump, and away it flies through third man
another one bites the dust! Short again, an aggressive mow, a steepling top-edge, and a running catch for Boucher behind the stumps
how did that miss! A low full-toss, late outswing, and that scuttled past the off stump by millimetres
outside off again, and rapidly through to the keeper
down the leg-side, and Afghanistan might not appreciate that. It means another delivery from Steyn
full and straight, and watchfully blocked. Arguably the first one to hit the middle of the bat all innings
down the leg-side, flicks the pad
beaten once again by Steyn's late swing
full but a touch wide, driven handsomely but only as far as short cover
that's just brutal. Short again, bangs the splice, loops coolly into the slip cordon, and another mugging of a dismissal
outside off, nudged down to third man
worked down to third man again
fizzing through all the defences, as Shenwari backs away towards the square leg umpire
Morkel oversteps, and here comes a Free hit
that's the way to do it! Short and swiped hard and handsomely over long-on for six, and that's the most celebrated shot of the night!
outside off, short in length again, and another over ticks by
edged, but safe, past the slips and picked up by third man
outside off, good lift from a good length, and through to the keeper
a wild and woolly swipe, and why not? No contact this time
on the hip and paddled away firmly, well fielded with a slide on the boundary's edge
another short ball, a half-formed pull shot, and that's simply snaffled at midwicket. Another step closer to the end of the road
on the pads, clipped fine
down the leg side, and that's another run to the total
clipped fine to escape the strike
that is seriously rapid, but he's overstepped. Another delivery added to the over
that was a free hit but no contact
on the pads, tucked to midwicket, and they run an overthrow as the shy hits the stumps. Umpire Taufel checks for the run-out but he's safely home
angling down the leg-side, deflected square
a dab to gully and an instant call, but you can't take on AB de Villiers in that position. An instant gather, an under-arm shy, and there's no need to see that one again
defended, but exceptionally uncomfortably. Another over ticks by
floated onto a good length, poked to gully
drawn forward and defended
good delivery, tweaking late to beat a limp push
driven firmly back to the bowler
defended once again
down the leg-side to spoil the over a touch
chopped out to gully once again. No runs off the bat in that over
get some of that! A gentle half-volley, in the slot, and that is lifted sweetly over long-off for six!
ambitious swish, but no contact this time
pushed back into the crease by a shorter length
hoisted hopefully into the leg-side, just wide of the fielder. More runs to the cause
raps the gloves with a sharp lifter. Good bowling
worked to midwicket with a gentle turn of the wrists. The absence of extreme pace has been rather cheering for Afghanistan
swung into the leg-side
an ambitious mow, no contact
solid defence from deep in the crease
clunked down to long-off
held back a touch, pushed off the back foot
flicked out to midwicket
punched off the back foot but straight to point
that's beautifully struck, just a touch short, and the absence of pace and extreme lift means there's no danger in hoisting that through mid-on
cracked out to the deep once again. Morkel intercepts at deep midwicket
battered down to mid-on to bring up the fifty, and it's been a spirited recovery against the slower bowlers
bouncer, no contact in the attempted pull
That. Is. Absolutely. Vast! The biggest hit of the night, a half-step down the track, a murderous swing of the blade, and that has cleared the stands and landed somewhere in the next parish!
played with one hand, on the up, out to cover.
forced onto the defensive by a quicker delivery
in the slot again, and another mighty blow. This is great to see, there's no meek surrender from these guys!
sensible defence, just to mix it up a touch
beaten this time, a quicker ball outside off
bashed out to deep cover, and the resistance continues
a bit of a limp delivery, slipping down the leg side
good delivery, tight on off stump, swinging in late to beat the inside-edge, and Ashraf's spirited cameo comes to an end
outside off, no stroke there
left alone as Shapoor watches the swing carefully
outside off, nudged down to third man
bouncer, and a good one. Shapoor turns turtle
misdirected, down the leg side
outside off, zips past the edge
swinging once again, but safely negotiated
battered! One step down the track, a full swing of the bat, and that clears cow corner by a distance
fired into the blockhole
worked off the hip, down to fine leg
swiped eagerly through the leg-side, but not quite middled
defended from a full length
angled down the leg-side, scooped to mid-on.
short, and a violent swing, but no contact
full length, looking for the baseball swipe, but gave himself too much room
teasing delivery, very full length, and zipping back into the right-hander. Defended down into the crease
making room again, and can't make contact
bouncer, and Hamid didn't know much about that pull shot, only that it somehow made it to the fine leg boundary
and that, alas, is the end of that. Another short ball, another mow, and another top-edge for Kallis to snaffle as he back-pedalled to collect the catch at slip
